text:
(1)
Baltic Street (vantage point, not seen), east of Bay Street. The view is in a northerly direction along the new bed of the Staten Island Railroad. On the extreme right are piers lining the shore of Upper New York Bay.

May 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Along the bank of the new railroad bed.

May 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Baltic Street (vantage point, not seen), east of Bay Street. The view is in a northerly direction along the new bed of the Staten Island Railroad. On the extreme right are piers lining the shore of Upper New York Bay.

May 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Along the bank of the new railroad bed.

May 16, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

Upper New York Bay, at Stapleton, Staten Island, showing piers 12 and 13, as viewed southeastward across the Staten Island Rapid Transit tracks from near Bay and Baltic Streets. These docks are part of the Foreign Trade Zone, established in 1936, for the transshipment and re-export, duty free, of foreign goods.

May 16, 1936

P. L. Sperr

(2)

Piers 13, and 12, viewing north from Front and Canal Streets.

P. L. Sperr
title: Upper New York Bay - Staten Island - Stapleton

text:

These docks are part of the Foreign Trade Zone, established in 1936, for the transshipment and re-export, duty free, of foreign goods.
